ch.epfl.lis.wingj

Class WJImages

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.epfl.lis.wingj.WJImages

  • public class WJImages
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a stack of images (3D image).
    Version:
    October 21, 2012
    Author:
    Thomas Schaffter (thomas.schaff...@gmail.com), Ricard Delgado-Gonzalo (ricard.delg...@gmail.com)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean allowImagesAutoLoading_
      Flag to enable the automatic loading of image stacks only once (click on Reset to clear it).
      static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> colorChannelIndex_
      Channel index associated to each RGB color.
      static java.lang.Integer[] firstSlicesIndex_
      First slice index to consider.
      static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> imageHeights_
      Contains the height of each image stack.
      static java.lang.String[] imageProjectionNames_
      Names of the image projections.
      static WJImagesMask imagesMask_
      Mask to only consider one system when multiple systems are on the same image.
      static java.lang.String[] imageStackNames_
      Names of the image stack.
      static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> imageWidths_
      Contains the width of each image stack.
      static java.lang.Integer[] lastSlicesIndex_
      Last slice index to consider.
      static java.lang.Integer[] numSlices_
      Contains the number of slices loaded for each channel.
      static boolean scaleAlreadyLoaded_
      Flag to indicate if an image scale has already been loaded.
      static java.lang.String[] selectionTags_
      Selection tag used for each channel.

      • saveAoi

        public static void saveAoi(java.net.URI uri)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Saves the AOI to TIFF file.

        If the user didn't explicitly defined an AOI, the AOI is a white rectangle which has the same dimension that the confocal image.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • readSliceDatasetAndOpenImages

        public static void readSliceDatasetAndOpenImages(java.net.URI uri)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads a slice dataset file and performs the actions required. Assumes that if the user left the selection tag blank or used the wild card '*', the slice dataset will contains the symbol '*' for the selection tag.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
